Odd.

You say you've done a programmatic listing but perhaps JConsole will 
give you a clue as to whats up.  If you pause after the registration and 
init of the ClusterControllerBean on port 8849, does it show in 
JConsole?  If so, is the string the client is using to query the mbean 
appropriate.

Anything other than Heritrix or hcc running in these JVMs?  Something 
that is putting up its own JMX Agent (A JBoss or a Tomcat, etc.): i.e. 
if more than one JMX Agent running in JVM, one might catch the Heritrix 
bean registrations, while other catches registration of hcc beans?

Both of the above are stretches but, as with you, I am a little 
stumped.  I see no reason why port should make a difference.
St.Ack

> >

> > ClusterControllerClient cc =

>
> I changed the JMX port for the hcc ClusterControllerBean &
> ClusterControllerClient so that they are the same as each other but
> different than the crawlers. I'd just like to verify with someone that
> that's how its supposed to work, so for example:
> All heritrix instances use JMX port x (like 8849)
> The hcc controller bean & client communincate on a different port 
> (like 8850)
>
> I thought different applications could use the same JMX port but if I
> use 8849 for all of the above, when I programatically list all the
> registered names at that host/JMX port only the crawlers show up.
>
> I think it works for me that all the heritrix crawlers use the same
> JMX port because they are running on different machines. Following the
> no app can use the same JMX port thing, if I have multiple heritrix
> containers running on the same machine - they would have to use
> different JMX ports, right?
>
> thanks,
> Andrea
>
>
